TopicTitle: MAW Maxi, a "technology" demonstrator aircraft influenced by the 777!

Articles.Content:
Hi there!

With the introduction of the new SLS parts, I had to rewrite the definition of the "wide body" jets in my KSP carreer. 3,75m fuselages became the new wide bodies, and the 2,5-metre wide fuselages became the basis for the new narrow-body commercial airliners.

The new 3,5m size category completely misses appropriate-sized jet engines (the ones in the game are way too small), therefore I had to build these larger engines instead of the normal smaller ones myself.

The MAW Maxi is the first commercial aircraft to be equipped with these new engines.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The aircraft itself is heavily influenced by the RL Boeing 777, the largest airliner featuring only 2 engines (however, it's not a replica of it). It flies well, having similar characteristics as an RL airliner (meaning it won't take off at 20 m/s and fly like a fighter). Its range is still very limited (some 100 kms, or so), but hey, it's still a kind of a prototype. It's capable of doing some hops to the island airport and back. It can take off at around 60m/s without tailstriking the ground, and needs at least this speed to land (though ~90-100 m/s is preferred for the smoothest landings).

Each engine - which is the most notable feature of this plane - is made out of 2 default jet engines (a basic, and a turbo jet) clipped into each other, capable of giving ~400kN of thrust combined. The base of the engine is an X200-16 fuel tank, sporting some decoration aswell.

Weight: 40,41 tons (fully loaded)

Part count: 131

Interested?

Download it here!

Edited May 27, 2014 by jmiki8
Not enough wingspan ... you'll burn more fuel that way.
